items.sentence: It may take a few weeks to get used to working the night shift.
It would be nice if we could get some new playground equipment.
Tom asked Mary what she thought he should do in this situation.
Tom asked Mary where she wanted him to put the bag of dog food.
Tom still loves Mary even though she doesn\'t love him anymore.
Tom wanted to ask a question, but he didn\'t want to seem dumb.
I\'d love to be able to spend less time doing household chores.
I\'ve done the best I could to help you. The rest is up to you.
Tom complained that he couldn\'t get that song out of his head.
If you have any time available today, I\'d like to talk to you.
Tom thought he was finished, but Mary told him that he wasn\'t.
Tom is the type of person who always has to have the last word.
Do you remember when Tom and Mary came here for the first time?
Tom told me that he couldn\'t blame me for breaking my promise.
Tom tried to remember the name of the girl he\'d met in Boston.
Tom had a good reason for not having his homework done on time.
I wonder whether or not Tom forgot to tell Mary not to do that.
I wonder whether or not Tom has told Mary she needs to do that.
It\'ll take Tom some time, but eventually he\'ll get over Mary.
Tom always told us that you can\'t teach an old dog new tricks.
